clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: Used for immediate control of life threatening convulsions in the treatment of severe toxemias pre eclampsia and eclampsia of pregnancy and in the treatment of acute nephritis in children Also indicated for replacement therapy in magnesium deficiency especially in acute hypomagnesemia accompanied by signs of tetany similar to those of hypocalcemia Also used in uterine tetany as a myometriat relaxant

contraindications.disease: LD sub 50 sub 1200 mg kg rat subcutaneous May be harmful if swallowed May act as an irritant Adverse reactions include hypotension ECG changes diarrhea urinary retention CNS depression and respiratory depression
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Magnesium sulfate is a small colorless crystal used as an anticonvulsant a cathartic and an electrolyte replenisher in the treatment of pre eclampsia and eclampsia It causes direct inhibition of action potentials in myometrial muscle cells Excitation and contraction are uncoupled which decreases the frequency and force of contractions Magnesium sulfate is gaining popularity as an initial treatment in the management of various dysrhythmias particularly torsades de pointes and dyrhythmias secondary to TCA overdose or digitalis toxicity

incompatibilities.description: Magnesium sulfate may increase the bradycardic activities of Ceritinib
Magnesium sulfate may increase the bradycardic activities of Ivabradine
Ruxolitinib may increase the bradycardic activities of Magnesium sulfate
Magnesium sulfate may increase the central nervous system depressant CNS depressant activities of Buprenorphine
Doxylamine may increase the central nervous system depressant CNS depressant activities of Magnesium sulfate
Hydroxyzine may increase the central nervous system depressant CNS depressant activities of Magnesium sulfate
